resources.string: Server IP has not been set yet.
Error reading saved polling delay setting
Error reading saved network timeout setting
Error reading saved timer format setting
Error reading setting if this is the first app start
IP syntax is not a valid
Server unavailable.\nHave you configured it in the layout\nand started it via Control > Start Server?
Can\'t synchronize game time while game is not running.
Your LiveSplit server may be outdated.\nPlease use the newest version or this app won\'t work properly.
The network can\'t keep up with the requests and messes up!\nMaybe you need to increase the polling delay.
Time between automatic timer synchronization.\nLower values may drain your battery faster.
Time to wait until deciding that something went wrong

This is a remote for the timer program LiveSplit.

In order to work you need to add
Control > LiveSplit Server to your layout and then start the server on the main window with
Rightclick > Control > Start Server.

The app requires an IP to know where to connect to your LiveSplit computer.

Development continues on GitHub.

If you want to contact me:
- GitHub
- Speedrun Tool Development Discord
- Email

This seems to be your first app start,
do you want to see a guide on how to set LiveSplit up with this app?

The guide is also accessible from the menu.

This guide will show you how to set up LiveSplit to work with this app.

It is also available on GitHub.

It is recommended to open the guide on your LiveSplit computer, so you can just click on the links there.

Download and extract LiveSplit 1.7 or newer:

http://livesplit.org/downloads/

Download and extract the LiveSplit server component (LiveSplit.Server_1.7.x.zip or newer) into the LiveSplit \"components\" sub-directory:

https://github.com/LiveSplit/LiveSplit.Server/releases
Add the LiveSplit Server component to your layout

Note your IP, you will need it for the app (You may also change port if necessary).

(This IP is needed so the app knows how to connect to your LiveSplit computer.)
Start the server (Windows may ask for firewall permissions, you have to allow it)
Go to the app settings and enter your IP (and port if you changed it)
1. LiveSplit server IP syntax is valid
2. LiveSplit server port syntax is valid
5. Device is connected to wifi network
6. Device has been assigned an IPv4 address
11. LiveSplit server component can process commands
Test has not been run for this check
LS Computer ping at %1$s was successful
LS server component could be successfully pinged at %1$s:%2$s
LS server component connection could be established
LS component could respond to \"getcurrenttimerphase\" with: %1$s

%1$s is not a valid IPv4 address. Please use the IP the computer is using, where LiveSplit is run on and enter it in the app settings. The syntax format must be something between 0.0.0.0 to 255.255.255.255
%1$s is not a valid port number. Please use the port the LiveSplit server component is using and enter it in the app settings. Ports must be between 0 and 65536

Somehow this app lost the necessary internet permission. Without this permission, the app will not work, not even in a local network. This app communicates with the LiveSplit server component via network socket, so it needs this permission. If you have a third-party permission remover gadget, please look into restoring the permissions for this app or try re-installing this app

Somehow this app lost the permission to access the network state. Without this permission, some tests here will fail, but the app itself might still work. If you have a third-party permission remover gadget, you may want to look into restoring the permission for this app or try re-installing this app

Somehow this app lost the permission to access the wifi state. Without this permission, some tests here will fail, but the app itself might still work. If you have a third-party permission remover gadget, you may want to look into restoring the permission for this app or try re-installing this app
Wifi seems to be disabled, enable it again? This app works via network socket to communicate with the LiveSplit server component in your network
Your device is not connected to a wifi network, check your wifi settings. Internal error: %1$s
Your device does not seem to have an IP assigned from your network. Check your wifi settings or your network. Internal error: %1$s
Your device seems to be assigned only the IPv6 address %1$s, this may cause problems. Check your wifi or network settings to assign an IPv4 for your device or hope it still works with IPv6
Network router could not be reached at %1$s. Please check your firewalls or router settings. Internal error: %2$s
The target computer could not be reached at %1$s. Please check your firewalls or router settings. Internal error: %2$s

The LS server component could not be reached at %1$s:%2$s. Please make sure you have LiveSplit and the server component working and running at the correct port. Also check your firewalls or router settings. Internal error: %3$s
The LS server component could establish a socket connection. Make sure the server component is up to date and running.
The LS server component could not process the command \"getcurrenttimerphase\". Make sure the server component is up to date and running.
